name: snippily
content:

in a way that is slightly rude and impatient, and uses only a few words: "What should I have done, then?" she asked, a little snippily. "My only interest is that of the child, I can assure you," he said snippily.
More examplesFewer examples"That's enough talking for now," I said, snippily."I have no desire to own anything that requires ironing," I replied snippily.When she refused to kiss him, he would withdraw from doing anything, and snippily ignore her.
